Equivalency_RuleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Equivalency_RuleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Equivalency_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Put_Equivalency_Rule_Request.description: Identifies equivalency rules using unique references for updates. Leave blank when creating equivalent rule.

Equivalency_Rule_Data.description: Reference ID for the equivalency rule.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Equivalency_Rule_Data.description: Source content for the equivalency rule.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Equivalency_Rule_Data.description: Target content for the equivalency rule.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Equivalency_Enabled_ContentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Equivalency_Rule_Data.description: Group content for the equivalency rule.
Indicates whether the equivalency rule is two-way or singular.
Effective from date for the equivalency rule.
Effective to date for the equivalency rule.
Indicates whether the equivalency rule is inactive.
Inactivation date for the equivalency rule.
Indicates whether the equivalency records are to appear on Learning History.
Indicates whether the equivalency options are to appear on Learning Course.

Put_Equivalency_Rule_Request.description: Contains data for the equivalency rule content, i.e. effective from date, effective to date etc.

validation.validation: Specify different source and target courses for the equivalency rule.
You need to specify a course as the target of the equivalency rule.
You can't change the content associated with this rule.
Specify an Effective From date that's before the Effective To date.
Workday automatically timestamps the inactivation date. You can't change the date.
You need to specify a course as the source of the equivalency rule.
You need to set the rule to active before you can change its values.
You can't change the direction of the rule.
You can't create two-way relationships for group equivalency rules.
Learning equivalency rules must have 1 or more Source and Target values, or multiple Content values, but not both.
You must include 2 or more content items in the group equivalency rule.
1 or more of the group equivalency learning content is inactive. To add content to a group equivalency rule, ensure that the content is active.
1 or more of the target learning content is inactive. To add target content to an equivalency rule, ensure that the content is active.
1 or more of the source learning content is inactive. To add source content to an equivalency rule, ensure that the content is active.

description: Contains all the request data to add or update an equivalency rule.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Free form text comment about the attachment.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Attachment Categories.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Element for the attachments pertaining to a Event entered through a web service.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Event Attachments.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.
